Welcome to Leisure and Culture

Knowsley mobile community facility and pre-school development

Funbus
The mobile community facility operates through a partnership
between the Youth and Play Service and Sure Start in North Huyton.
There are three strands of work:
for children aged 2 to 4 years in the North Huyton Sure Start area
who are not accessing any play services. All activities are planned
to early years foundation stage stepping stones. These activities
help to develop skills in the following areas:
Children must be registered to attend the two hour play session
which is delivered by qualified play staff and nursery nurses.
<li>New Deal for communities and Sure Start speech and language
The mobile community facility has been working in partnership
Knowsley's town centres area some of the venues that have been
used for promotions and the funbus regularly attends fun days
a great success since the start of the programme in 2004. The
'Share Family Learning' programme includes early years play
healthy living and early years life skills. These are just some of
the themes that have been used to develop quality fun activities
Parents and carers attending have the option for their work to
be accredited by the Merseyside Open College Network (MOCN). These
courses provide parents and carers with the opportunity to access
further education and training if they so choose.
For further information contact the mobile community facility on
The Sure Start funded pre-school development project aims to
develop and support groups and activities for the under 5's in the
Examples of the sessions which operate are:
• pool club - water play for babies and toddlers
• baby massage - learning to relax and bond with your baby
<li>grandparents and carers group - chance to network and meet
other grandparents and carers whilst children play.
The pre-school development project works alongside portage
midwives and other Sure Start professionals. The project offers
under 5's an opportunity to enjoy activities and develop through

column2: whilst empowering the adults to gain

column1: confidence and develop activities and groups themselves.
For further information contact pre-school development on 0151
